intro: Lastrea glabella, commonly known as the smooth lastrea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically yellow or green, and it produces small, rounded seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
